p: Quarto is a multi-language, next generation version of R Markdown from RStudio, with many new features and capabilities. Like R Markdown, Quarto uses Knitr to execute R code, and is therefore able to render most existing Rmd files without modification.
We’ll start by covering the basics of Quarto, then delve into the differences between Quarto and R Markdown in the sections on Chunk Options and Output Formats below.
Code blocks that use braces around the language name (e.g. ```{r}) are executable, and will be run by Quarto during render. Here is a simple example:

ac:structured-macro.ac:plain-text-body:
--- title: "ggplot2 demo" author: "Norah Jones" date: "5/22/2021" format: html: code-fold: true ---
## Air Quality
@fig-airquality further explores the impact of temperature on ozone level.
```{r} #| label: fig-airquality #| fig-cap: Temperature and ozone level. #| warning: false
library(ggplot2)
ggplot(airquality, aes(Temp, Ozone)) + geom_point() + geom_smooth(method = "loess") ```

p: Figure 1 further explores the impact of temperature on ozone level.
